decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The first floor side to rear extension, by reason of its poor and incompatible design, excessive width, and contrived roof design in conjunction with the existing hip-to-gable end enlargement and rear dormer would introduce bulky, incongruous and disproportionate additions of overall poor incohesive design that would serve to subsume the rear elevation of the existing dwellinghouse and the scale, character and appearance of the neighbouring properties, the development is therefore detrimental to the character and appearance of the existing dwellinghouse and the adjacent dwelling, contrary to The National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy D3.D(1) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010).

Reason : 2 - The proposed elevations and floorplans by reason of inconsistencies in drawing scale in conjunction with the proposed site plan showing the enlarged footprint of the dwelling, prevent the Local Planning Authority's from being able to make an accurate assessment of the proposal in terms of its impact to the neighbouring residential amenities of no.24 Kenton Lane, the proposal is therefore contrary to the high quality design aspirations of The National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policies D3.D(7) of The London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).
description: Single storey rear extension; first floor side to rear extension;  installation of window to front at ground floor level; external alterations
